content.description: Climb the obvious ice flow to the right of Gully # 1-1/2. The start is usually steep and rocky and typically requires some mixed climbing to reach the thick ice. Above the hard bottom bit, climb easier ice to the top.Starting directly under the flow and climbing straight up is usually harder (4+).
content.location: This is the obvious ice flow to the right of Gully # 1-1/2.

content.description: From the base of Cinema Gully, go up and left on snow ramps until you reach a right trending ramp up the steep rock wall above you.P1: Rock climb up and right on the right trending ramp to its end (5.7). The FA party used one point of aid to get over the lip of the steep wall onto the icy slabs. Belay just above at trees.P2: Climb up easy snow and ice through some trees to another belay from trees.P3: Climb an ice flow to the huge tree covered ledge.
content.location: This route climbs between Gully # 3 (Great Madness) and Cinema Gully.

content.description: The lower tier of Mt. Willard's south face contains climbs from WI2 to WI5. ( Name changed to “Main Face” to correspond to the rock climbing nomenclature. R Hall NH Admin 1/7/21)
